title: Fragment, 16th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: silk velvet: cut loops of supplementary warps in a plain weave foundation. Two pile warps per pile warp unit.  Plain weave modified so that one warp thick and held under high tension and other warp thin and held under less tension
dimensions:
warp: 36cm (14 1/8") weft: 20cm (7 3/4")
Pattern: Unit of straight repeat: warp: 39.5cm (15 1/2")                                                     weft: 22cm   (8 1/2")
description: Slightly less than one unit of a straight repeat of a hunting scene with man on horse aiming arrow at deer, standing man with bow having shot a fox, leopard, rabbit and bushes. Colors: Light green pattern on off white background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, 16th century.Medium: silk
Technique: silk velvet: cut loops of supplementary warps in a plain weave foundation. Two pile warps per pile warp unit.  Plain weave modified so that one warp thick and held under high tension and other warp thin and held under less tension . 1969-100-1-a/c.
